availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John H. Taylor (Fayette County, Kentucky, hack driver and livery stable keeper)

body.p: Fayette County, Kentucky, hack driver and livery stable keeper. Kentucky native. Son of Charlotte Taylor. Married to Emily Taylor. Father of George Taylor, Mary Taylor, Charlotte Taylor, Cathrin Taylor, Mariah Taylor, Julia Taylor, and John H. Taylor. Hack driver in Lexington, Kentucky, in 1850. Livery stable keeper in Lexington in 1860. Accused of receiving stolen corn in February 1864. Fugitive in 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington, District 2, p. 198A-B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington, p. 581.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington Ward 3, p. 254B-255A.
KYR-0001-004-0986.
